elements.semanticDescription: A unique identification of the Invoice
elements.usageNote: The sequential number required in Article 226(2) of the directive 2006/112/EC [2], to uniquely identify the Invoice within the business context, time-frame, operating systems and records of the Seller. It may be based on one or more series of numbers, which may include alphanumeric characters. No Identification Scheme is to be used.

elements.semanticDescription: The date when the Invoice was issued.
The time of the day when the Invoice was issued.
A code specifying the functional type of the Invoice.
elements.usageNote:
Commercial invoices and credit notes are defined according to the entries in UNTDID 1001 [6].
Other entries of UNTDID 1001 [6] with specific invoices or credit notes may be used if applicable.
The subset of UNTDID 1001 that may be used is managed by or on behalf of CEN/TC434.

elements.semanticDescription: The currency in which all Invoice amounts are given, except for the Total VAT amount in accounting currency.
elements.usageNote:
Only one currency shall be used in the Invoice, except for the Invoice total VAT amount in accounting currency (BT-111) in accordance with article 230 of Directive 2006/112/EC on VAT [2].
The lists of valid currencies are registered with the ISO 4217 Maintenance Agency “Codes for the representation of currencies and funds”.

elements.semanticDescription: The currency used for VAT accounting and reporting purposes as accepted or required in the country of the Seller.
elements.usageNote:
Shall be used in combination with the Invoice total VAT amount in accounting currency (BT-111) when the VAT accounting currency code differs from the Invoice currency code.
The lists of valid currencies are registered with the ISO 4217 Maintenance Agency “Codes for the representation of currencies and funds”. Please refer to Article 230 of the Council Directive 2006/112/EC [2] for more information. For reporting purposes another currency may be used (BT-168).

elements.semanticDescription: The value of a unit accounting currency, expressed in invoicing currency
The currency used for VAT reporting purposes as accepted or required in the country of the Seller if different from accounting currency.
elements.usageNote: The lists of valid currencies are registered with the ISO 4217 Maintenance Agency “Codes for the representation of currencies and funds”. Please refer to Article 230 of the Council Directive 2006/112/EC [2] for more information.

elements.semanticDescription: The value of a unit reporting currency, expressed in invoicing currency
The date when the VAT becomes accountable for the Seller and for the Buyer in so far as that date can be determined and differs from the date of issue of the invoice, according to the VAT directive.
elements.usageNote:
The tax point is usually the date goods were supplied or services completed (the 'basic tax point'). There are some variations. Please refer to Article 226 (7) of the Council Directive 2006/112/EC [2] for more information.
This element is required if the Value added tax point date is different from the Invoice issue date.
Both Buyer and Seller should use the Tax Point Date when provided by the Seller. The use of BT-7 and BT-8 is mutually exclusive.

elements.businessTerm: Value added tax point date code
elements.semanticDescription: The code of the date when the VAT becomes accountable for the Seller and for the Buyer.
elements.usageNote:
The code shall distinguish between the following entries of UNTDID 2005 [6]:
- Invoice document issue date
- Delivery date, actual
- Paid to date. The Value Added Tax point date code is used if the Value Added Tax point date is not known when the invoice is issued. The use of BT-8 and BT-7 is mutually exclusive.

elements.semanticDescription: The date when the payment is due.
elements.usageNote: The payment due date reflects the due date of the net payment. For partial payments it states the first net due date. The corresponding description of more complex payment terms can be stated in BT-20 Payment terms.

elements.semanticDescription: An Identifier assigned by the Buyer used for internal routing purposes.
elements.usageNote:
The Identifier is defined by the Buyer (e.g. department or office id),and returned by the Seller in the Invoice.

A conditional scheme Identifier may be used that shall be chosen from the UNTDID 1153 code list [6] entries.

elements.semanticDescription: The identification of the project the invoice refers to
The identification of a contract.
elements.usageNote: The contract Identifier should be unique in the context of the specific trading relationship and for a defined time period.

elements.semanticDescription: An Identifier of a referenced purchase order, issued by the Buyer.
An Identifier of a referenced sales order, issued by the Seller.
An Identifier of a referenced receiving advice.
An Identifier of a referenced despatch advice.
An Identifier of a referenced delivery note
The identification of the call for tender or lot the invoice relates to.
elements.usageNote: In some countries a reference to the call for tender that has led to the contract shall be provided.

elements.semanticDescription:
An Identifier for an object on which the invoice is based, given by the Seller.

The Identification Scheme Identifier of the Invoiced object Identifier.
elements.usageNote:
It may be a subscription number, telephone number, meter point, vehicle, person etc., as applicable.

If it may be not clear for the receiver what scheme is used for the Identifier, a conditional scheme Identifier should be used that shall be chosen from the UNTDID 1153 code list [6] entries.

schemeIdentifier.schemeDescription: An Identifier for an object on which the invoice is based, given by the Seller.
schemeIdentifier.schemeUsageNote: If it may be not clear for the receiver what scheme is used for the Identifier, a conditional scheme Identifier should be used that shall be chosen from the UNTDID 1153 code list [6] entries.

elements.semanticDescription: A reference provided by the Buyer for routing of the invoice to the correct accounting department or person.

childElements.semanticDescription: A textual description of the payment terms that apply to the amount due for payment (Including description of possible discounts and penalties).
childElements.usageNote: This element may contain multiple lines

childElements.semanticDescription: The date when the early payment discount is valid until.
Percentage of the Invoice total amount with VAT (BT-112) to be discounted from the amount to be paid.
childElements.usageNote: Percentages do not cumulate: if payment after 60 days adds a penalty of 10% and payment after 120 days adds 20%, the penalty after 130 days is 20%.

childElements.semanticDescription: Amount (incl. of VAT) to be discounted from the amount to be paid.
childElements.usageNote: Percentages do not cumulate: if payment after 60 days adds a penalty of 10% and payment after 120 days adds 20%, the penalty after 130 days is 20%.

childElements.semanticDescription: The date when the late payment penalty is valid until.
Percentage of the Invoice total amount with VAT (BT-112) to be added to the amount to be paid.
childElements.usageNote: Percentages do not cumulate: if payment after 60 days adds a penalty of 10% and payment after 120 days adds 20%, the penalty after 130 days is 20%.

childElements.semanticDescription: (Incl. of VAT) to be added to the amount to be paid.

elements.semanticDescription: A group of Business Terms providing textual notes that are relevant for the invoice, together with an indication of the note subject.

childElements.semanticDescription: The subject of the textual note in BT-22.
childElements.usageNote: To be chosen from the entries in UNTDID 4451 [6].

childElements.semanticDescription: A textual note that gives unstructured information that is relevant to the Invoice as a whole.
childElements.usageNote: Such as the reason for any correction or assignment note in case the invoice has been factored

elements.semanticDescription: A group of Business Terms providing information on the business process and rules applicable to the Invoice document.

childElements.semanticDescription: Identifies the business process context in which the transaction appears, to enable the Buyer to process the Invoice in an appropriate way.
childElements.usageNote: To be specified by the Buyer.

childElements.semanticDescription: An identification of the specification containing the total set of rules regarding semantic content, cardinalities and business rules to which the data contained in the instance document conforms.
childElements.usageNote: This identifies compliance or conformance to this document. Core Conformant invoices specify: urn:cen.eu:en16931:2017. Invoices, conformant to a user specification may identify that user specification here.

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information on one or more preceding Invoices.
elements.usageNote:
This group is used in case the Invoice corrects a previously sent Invoice. The reference is the Invoice number of the preceding Invoice.
In the case of credit notes this group may be used as a reference to the related original invoice(s).

In Germany (§14 Abs. 4 UStG), in case of credit notes correcting an existing invoice, BG-1 must contain the invoice number of the corrected invoice.
In Germany (§14 Abs. 4 UStG), in case of corrections to an existing invoice other than credit notes the correction needs to have its own invoice number (BT-1) and refer to the corrected invoice (BT-1, BT-2) using BG-1.

If the Seller does not know the issue date of the preceding invoice, he can use 01-01-1900.

Multiple preceding invoice references are allowed. However, their use is not recommended.

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information about the Seller.
elements.usageNote: Information about the Seller, the supplier of the goods or services. The Seller is the legal entity who is responsible for the subject of the Invoice.

childElements.semanticDescription: A name used by the Seller for trading purposes, different from the Seller name (also known as Business name).
childElements.usageNote: This element may be used if the Seller trades under a different name than the Seller's formal name.

childElements.semanticDescription: Additional legal information relevant for the Seller.
childElements.usageNote: Examples: "Besloten Vennootschap" or "Société Anonyme" or "GmbH" or "Ltd".

childElements.businessTerm:
Seller legal registration identifier

Scheme identifier
childElements.semanticDescription:
An identifier issued by an official registrar that identifies the Seller as a legal entity or person.

The identification scheme identifier of the Seller legal registration identifier
childElements.usageNote:
In the case the Seller is part of a group, the identifier for the group may be used here.
The identifier is specified by the scheme identifier.
The scheme identifier shall distinguish between the different identification schemes, e.g. the code issued by the registrar is used as the scheme identifier.

childElements.semanticDescription:
The Seller's VAT identifier (also known as Seller VAT identification number).

The Identification Scheme Identifier of the Seller VAT Identifier. Is always VAT
childElements.usageNote:
The VAT identifier has a prefix in accordance with ISO code ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 by which the Member State of issue may be identified. The code "EL" is used for Greece.
For trading with non-EU countries possible prefixes are defined in the rules for VAT identification numbers published by the national tax authorities.
Vat identifiers may be specified with prefixes for countries outside EU such as NO for Norway.
The VAT identifier shall not be duplicatively stated if it is used as the Seller electronic address (BT-29) for routing purposes.
childElements.businessRulesAndConditions: BR-AE-1, BR-AE-2, BR-AE-3, BR-AE-4, BR-CO-9, BR-CO-27, BR-IC-1, BR-IC-2, BR-IC-3, BR-IC-4, BR-S-2, BR-S-3, BR-S-4

childElements.businessTerm:
Seller tax registration identifier

Scheme identifier
childElements.semanticDescription:
The local identification (defined by the Seller's address) of the Seller for tax purposes or a reference number issued by the Governmental tax agency.

The Identification Scheme Identifier of the Seller tax registration identifier.
childElements.usageNote:
Example: The French SIRET number. In this case the scheme identifier could be "SIRET".
Used for taxes other than VAT.

childElements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing the postal address for the Seller.
childElements.usageNote:
The Seller address shall provide enough details to be able to locate the Seller.
The country code shall be encoded using the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code list [5].

childElements.semanticDescription:
The electronic address to which the Buyer sends the application level response to the invoice

The identification scheme identifier of the Seller electronic address
childElements.usageNote:
The electronic address identifier shall be unique and persistent.
The identification scheme is mandatory and shall identify the type of identifier used for the electronic address. Examples of identification scheme identifiers are qualifier "EM" for e-mail address, qualifier "99xx" for GLN number where xx identifies the GLN administering agency, qualifier "0088" for EAN location number administered by GS1, or the national identification scheme identifiers as described in the list published by the Connecting Europe Facility.

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing contact information about the Seller.
A group of business terms providing information about the Buyer.
elements.usageNote: Information about the recipient of the goods or services.

childElements.semanticDescription: A name used by the Buyer for trading purposes, different from the Buyer name.
childElements.usageNote: This element may be used if the Buyer trades under a different name than the Buyer's legal name.

childElements.businessTerm:
Buyer legal registration identifier

Scheme Identifier
childElements.semanticDescription:
An identifier issued by an official registrar that identifies the Buyer as a legal entity or person.

The Identification Scheme Identifier of the Buyer legal registration identifier.
childElements.usageNote: The identifier is specified by the scheme identifier. The scheme identifier shall distinguish between the different identification schemes, e.g. the code issued by the registrar is used as the scheme identifier.

childElements.semanticDescription:
The Buyer's VAT identifier (also known as Buyer VAT identification number).

The Identification Scheme Identifier of the Buyer VAT Identifier. Is always VAT
childElements.usageNote: The VAT identifier has a prefix in accordance with ISO code ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 by which the Member State of issue may be identified. The code "EL" is used for Greece.
childElements.businessRulesAndConditions: BR-AE-1, BR-AE-2, BR-AE-3, BR-AE-4, BR-CO-10, BR-IC-1, BR-IC-2, BR-IC-3, BR-IC-4

childElements.businessTerm:
Buyer tax registration identifier

Scheme identifier
childElements.semanticDescription:
The local identification (defined by the Buyer's address) of the Buyer for tax purposes or a reference number issued by the Governmental tax agency.

The Identification Scheme Identifier of the Buyer tax registration identifier.
childElements.usageNote: Used for taxes other than VAT.

childElements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing the postal address for the Buyer.
childElements.usageNote:
The Buyer address shall provide enough details to be able to locate the Buyer.
The country code must be encoded using the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code list [5].

childElements.semanticDescription:
Identifies the Buyer's electronic address to which the invoice is delivered.

The Identification Scheme Identifier of the Buyer electronic address
childElements.usageNote:
The electronic address identifier shall be unique and persistent.
The identification scheme is mandatory and shall identify the type of identifier used for the electronic address. Examples of identification scheme identifiers are qualifier "EM" for e-mail address, qualifier "99xx" for GLN number where xx identifies the GLN administering agency, qualifier "0088" for EAN location number administered by GS1, or the national identification scheme identifiers as described in the list published by the Connecting Europe Facility.

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing contact information about the Buyer.
A group of business terms providing information about the Payee, i.e. the role that receives the payment.
elements.usageNote: This group shall only be used when the Payee is different from the Seller. E.g. in case of factoring.

childElements.semanticDescription:
An identifier for the Payee.

The identification scheme identifier of the Payee identifier.
childElements.usageNote:
The Payee identifier should be specified using a scheme identifier to indicate what scheme is used.

If it may be not clear for the receiver what scheme is used for the Identifier, a conditional scheme Identifier should be used that shall be chosen from the UNTDID 1153 code list [6] entries.

childElements.semanticDescription: An identifier issued by an official registrar that identifies the Payee as a legal entity or person.
childElements.usageNote: The identifier is specified by the scheme identifier.

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information about the Seller's tax representative.
elements.usageNote: In some countries the Seller may be required to register for tax in the country of the Buyer. This may require the Seller to appoint a tax representative who is responsible for dealing with the taxation authorities. The tax representative is legally responsible for the taxes of the Seller within the country.

childElements.businessTerm:
Seller tax representative VAT identifier

Scheme Identifier
childElements.semanticDescription:
The VAT identifier of the Seller's tax representative.

The Identification Scheme Identifier of the Seller tax representative VAT Identifier. Is always VAT
childElements.usageNote:
Conditional element.
The VAT identifier has a prefix in accordance with ISO code ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 by which the Member State of issue may be identified. The code "EL" is used for Greece.

childElements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing the postal address of the tax representative.
childElements.usageNote: The country code shall be using the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code list [5].

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information on the place and time of delivery or period.
elements.usageNote: For Invoices that are not subject to simplified invoicing rules according to the VAT directive 2006/112/EC article 226b and 238, the delivery details group must be present and contain a deliver to party name or a delivery location.

childElements.semanticDescription: The date when the goods were delivered or services rendered.
childElements.usageNote: The date may be the same as the Value added tax point date (BT-7).

childElements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing the name and address of the party to which the goods/services are delivered.
A group of business terms providing the address and the identifier of the location to where the goods are delivered or services are rendered.
childElements.usageNote: The delivery location shall be identified using the BT-71 Delivery location identifier or using the BT-70 Deliver to address or both.

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information about the payment.
elements.usageNote: This group contains the information necessary to initiate the payment. This group should only be used when the information is needed to be stated in the Invoice to initiate the payment. In some countries it is legally required.

childElements.businessTerm:
Payment means type code

Scheme identifier
childElements.semanticDescription:
The means, expressed as code, for how the payment is expected to be or has been settled.

The Identification Scheme Identifier of the Payment means type code
childElements.usageNote:
The entries of the UN/EDIFACT code list 4461 are recommended to be used. The following codes should be used: 10, 20, 30, 31, 42, 48, 49, 50, 54, 55, 56, 57, 58, 59, 60, 68, 70.

A distinction should be made between SEPA and non-SEPA payments. A payment mean shall identify if it is a SEPA Credit transfer, non-SEPA Credit Transfer, SEPA Direct Debit or non-SEPA Direct Debit etc.

A conditional scheme Identifier may be used that shall be chosen from the UNTDID 1153 code list [6] entries.

childElements.semanticDescription: The means, expressed as text, for how the payment is expected to be or has been settled.
A textual description of the payment terms that apply to the amount due for payment (Including description of possible discounts and penalties).
childElements.usageNote:
This element may contain multiple lines and reference numbers defined by the Seller or Buyer.

It is recommended to use this element for the primary remittance information. For more detailed payment references Payment identifier (BT-94) is recommended.

childElements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms to specify credit transfer payments.
A group of business terms providing information about card payments.
A group of business terms providing information about direct debit payments.
childElements.usageNote: This information is only provided by the Seller when he is the Payee.

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information about allowances applicable to the Invoice as a whole.
elements.usageNote: Allowances reduces the amount to be paid.

childElements.semanticDescription: The amount of an allowance, without VAT.
The base amount that may be used, in conjunction with the document level allowance percentage, to calculate the document level allowance amount.
The percentage that may be used, in conjunction with the document level allowance base amount, to calculate the document level allowance amount.
childElements.usageNote: Format shall be extended to maximum 4 decimals. E.g. 12.3456 means 12.3456 %.

childElements.businessTerm: Document level allowance VAT category code
childElements.semanticDescription: A coded identification of the VAT category applicable to the document level allowance.
childElements.usageNote: The Document level allowance VAT category code and the Document level allowance VAT rate shall point to the same VAT category. These codes should be aligned with the codes used for the VAT breakdown group (BG-23).

childElements.semanticDescription: The VAT rate, represented as percentage that applies to the document level allowance.
childElements.usageNote:
The Document level allowance VAT category code and the Document level allowance VAT rate shall point to the same VAT category.
To be used if VAT category code is subject to change or ambiguity.
Format shall be extended to maximum 4 decimals. E.g. 12.3456 means 12.3456 %.

childElements.semanticDescription: An identifier for the document level allowance.
childElements.usageNote: E.g. campaign number, promotion number.

childElements.semanticDescription: A coded identifier for the document level allowance.
childElements.usageNote: Shall be from the UNTDID 5189 code list [6].

childElements.semanticDescription: The reason for the document level allowance, expressed as text.
childElements.usageNote:
Free text description of the allowance.
Shall be used if no document level allowance reason code is provided.

childElements.semanticDescription: The reason for the document level allowance, expressed as a code.
childElements.usageNote:
Shall be used if no document level allowance reason text is provided.
Code list is based on UNTDID 5189 [6].

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information about charges applicable to the Invoice as a whole.
elements.usageNote: Charges increases the amount to be paid.

childElements.semanticDescription: The amount of a charge, without VAT.
The base amount that may be used, in conjunction with the document level charge percentage, to calculate the document level charge amount.
The percentage that may be used, in conjunction with the document level charge base amount, to calculate the document level charge amount.
childElements.usageNote: Format shall be extended to maximum 4 decimals. E.g. 12.3456 means 12.3456 %.

childElements.businessTerm: Document level charge VAT category code
childElements.semanticDescription: A coded identification of the VAT category applicable to the document level charge.
childElements.usageNote: The Document level charge VAT category code and the Document level charge VAT rate shall point to the same VAT category. These codes should be aligned with the codes used for the VAT breakdown group BG-23.

childElements.semanticDescription: The VAT rate, represented as percentage, applicable to the document level charge.
childElements.usageNote:
The Document level charge VAT category code and the Document level charge VAT rate shall point to the same VAT category.
To be used if VAT category code is subject to change or ambiguity.
Format shall be extended to maximum 4 decimals. E.g. 12.3456 means 12.3456 %.

childElements.semanticDescription: An identifier for the document level charge.
childElements.usageNote: E.g. environmental tax.

childElements.semanticDescription: A coded identifier for the document level charge.
childElements.usageNote: Shall be from the UNTDID 7161 code list [6].

childElements.semanticDescription: The reason for the document level charge, expressed as text.
childElements.usageNote:
Free text description of the charge.
Shall be used if no charge reason code is provided.

childElements.semanticDescription: The reason for the document level charge, expressed as a code.
childElements.usageNote:
Shall be used if no document level charge reason text is provided.
Code list is based on UNTDID 7161 [6].

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms regarding the payment service provider
elements.usageNote: Only used with Payment terms (BG-20). The payment service provider's identifier shall be conditional specified.

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing the monetary totals for the Invoice.

childElements.businessTerm: Sum of Invoice line net amounts
childElements.semanticDescription: Sum of all Invoice line net amounts in the Invoice.

childElements.businessTerm: Sum of allowances on document level
childElements.semanticDescription: Sum of all allowances on document level in the Invoice.
childElements.usageNote: Total allowance amount charged to the Invoice as a whole.

childElements.businessTerm: Sum of charges on document level
childElements.semanticDescription: Sum of all charges on document level in the Invoice.
childElements.usageNote: Total charges amount charged to the Invoice as a whole.

childElements.semanticDescription: The total amount of the Invoice without VAT.
childElements.usageNote:
BT-109 = BT-106 - BT-107 + BT-108.

This calculation may differ if calculation rules for allowances and charges are defined in the applicable specification.

childElements.semanticDescription: The total VAT amount for the Invoice.
childElements.usageNote:
Shall be rounded to two decimals.

The Invoice total VAT amount is the sum of all VAT category tax amounts (BT-117).

childElements.businessTerm: Invoice total VAT amount in accounting currency
childElements.semanticDescription: The total VAT amount expressed in the accounting currency accepted or required in the country of the Seller.
childElements.usageNote:
To be used when the VAT accounting currency (BT-6) differs from the Invoice currency (BT-5).

The VAT amount in accounting currency is solely for reporting purposes by the Seller to the tax authority. The Buyer is not liable for this amount.

Shall be expressed in the VAT accounting currency code reported in BT-6.

childElements.businessTerm: Invoice total VAT amount in reporting currency
childElements.semanticDescription: The total VAT amount expressed in the reporting currency accepted or required in the country of the Seller.
childElements.usageNote:
To be used when the VAT reporting currency (BT-168) differs from the Invoice currency (BT-5).

The VAT amount in reporting currency is solely for reporting purposes by the Seller to the tax authority. The Buyer is not liable for this amount.

Shall be expressed in the VAT reporting currency code reported in BT-168.

childElements.semanticDescription: The total amount of the Invoice with VAT.
childElements.usageNote:
BT-112 = BT-109 + BT-110.
If the VAT amount is provided as 0 (zero), e.g. for reasons of exemption, the total amount with VAT equals the total amount without VAT.

childElements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms that specify Tax sub schemes used in the Invoice
The sum of amounts which have been paid in advance.
childElements.usageNote: Paid amount must be less than the Invoice total amount with VAT (BT-112).

childElements.semanticDescription: The amount to be added to the Invoice total to round the amount to be paid.
childElements.usageNote:
This amount is added or subtracted from the Invoice total amount with VAT (BT-112) to calculate the amount due for payment (BT-115).
May be used to express cash rounding. If used, the amount shall be between -0.99 and 0.99.

childElements.semanticDescription: The outstanding amount that is requested to be paid.
childElements.usageNote: BT-115 = BT-112 - BT-113 + BT-114. Amount is zero in case of a fully paid Invoice.

childElements.semanticDescription: The correction amount that is subtracted from the sum of billing period amounts and correction amounts of previous correction messages.

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information about the VAT breakdown by different categories, rates and exemption reasons.
elements.usageNote:
This group is mandatory to provide the VAT breakdown on VAT category level.
It provides the VAT category tax amount and the VAT category taxable amount for each VAT category.
Sum of VAT category tax amounts (BT-117) equals Invoice total VAT amount (BT-110).

childElements.semanticDescription: Sum of all taxable amounts subject to a specific VAT category code and VAT category rate (if the VAT category rate is applicable).
childElements.usageNote:
The sum of Invoice line net amount minus sum of allowances on document level plus sum of charges on document level.
The sum of the amounts of all lines that has the same VAT rate and category.

childElements.semanticDescription: The total VAT amount for a specific VAT category.
childElements.usageNote: Calculated by multiplying the VAT category taxable amount (BT-116) with the VAT category rate (BT-119) for the specific VAT category.

childElements.semanticDescription: A coded identification of a VAT category.
childElements.usageNote:
Shall be taken from the UNTDID 5305 code list [6]:
Standard rated (code S), Zero rated goods (code Z), Exempt from tax (code E), VAT Reverse Charge (code AE), VAT exempt for intra community supply of goods and services (code K), Raw material (code A), Services outside scope of tax (code O). Code O represents 'outside scope of VAT'. The code IGDS represents 'Intra-governmental Deferment Scheme'. One of these codes has to be used for each different VAT category identified in the Invoice. The codes used shall be unique within this group.

childElements.semanticDescription: The VAT rate, represented as percentage that applies for the relevant VAT category.
childElements.usageNote:
Format shall be extended to maximum 4 decimals. E.g. 12.3456 means 12.3456 %.
Mandatory if the VAT category code is "Standard rated". In all other cases this element may be absent.
The VAT category rate shall be provided, if the VAT category code (BT-118) is Standard rated.

Zero rates shall be provided as 0.

childElements.semanticDescription: A textual statement of the reason why the amount is exempted from VAT or why no VAT is charged.
childElements.usageNote:
This element shall be used if the VAT category code (BT-118) is 'Exempt from VAT'.
Shall be used if no VAT exemption reason code is provided.

childElements.semanticDescription: A coded statement of the reason for why the amount is exempted from VAT.
childElements.usageNote:
The code identifying the reason for exemption. The code list is maintained by the Connecting Europe Facility.
Shall be used if no VAT exemption reason text is provided.

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information about additional documents supporting the Invoice.
elements.usageNote: The supporting document can be an attachment as a separate file or it can be embedded into the invoice as Base64 data. The element attached document (BT-125) must not contain more than 1MB.

childElements.semanticDescription: An identifier for the supporting document.
childElements.usageNote: Examples: timesheet number, service report number etc.

childElements.semanticDescription: A description of the supporting document.
The URL (Uniform Resource Locator) at which the external document is located.
childElements.usageNote: The URL shall be used to identify the location.

childElements.semanticDescription:
An attached document embedded as binary object or sent together with the invoice.

The mime code of the attached document.
childElements.usageNote:
The document may be attached. The Base64 encoded data is provided in the content element. The attachment cannot exceed 1 MB.
The mime code of the attachment must be specified.

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information on individual Invoice lines.

childElements.semanticDescription: A unique identifier for the individual line within the Invoice.
childElements.usageNote: The identifier shall be unique within the Invoice. Example 1, 2, 3 etc.

childElements.semanticDescription: A textual note that gives unstructured information that is relevant to the Invoice line.

childElements.businessTerm:
Invoice line object identifier

Scheme identifier
childElements.semanticDescription:
An identifier for an object on which the invoice line is based, given by the Seller.

The Identification Scheme Identifier of the Invoice line object identifier.
childElements.usageNote:
It may be a subscription number, telephone number, meter point, vehicle, person etc., as applicable.

If it may be not clear for the receiver what scheme is used for the Identifier, a conditional scheme Identifier should be used that shall be chosen from the UNTDID 1153 code list [6] entries.

childElements.semanticDescription: The quantity of items (goods or services) that is charged in the Invoice line.
The unit of measure that applies to the invoiced quantity.
childElements.usageNote: The unit of measure shall be coded using the UN/ECE Recommendation 20, including common codes [7] [8].

childElements.semanticDescription: The total net amount of the Invoice line. Amount = (Item net price (BT-146) * Invoiced quantity (BT-129)) + Sum of invoice line charge amount (BT-141) - sum of invoice line allowance amount (BT-136).
childElements.usageNote: The sum of net amounts for all Invoice lines shall equal the Sum of Invoice line net amounts (BT-106).

childElements.semanticDescription: Reason for correction of amount of a line
childElements.usageNote: If the line amount is not zero, it has to be indicated why it is a positive or negative correction.

childElements.semanticDescription: The Identifier of the purchase order line, issued by the Buyer, to which the Invoice line refers.

childElements.businessTerm: Reference to receiving advice line reference
childElements.semanticDescription: The Identifier of the receiving advice line, issued by the Buyer, to which the Invoice line refers.

childElements.businessTerm: Reference to despatch advice line reference
childElements.semanticDescription: The Identifier of the despatch advice line, issued by the Seller, to which the Invoice line refers.
The Identifier of the delivery note line, issued by the Seller, to which the Invoice line refers.
The country where the supply took place according to the VAT rules.
childElements.usageNote: Shall be encoded using the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code list [5].

childElements.businessTerm: Invoice line accounting Debit account reference
childElements.semanticDescription: The Buyer assigned accounting reference for the Invoice Line indicating the account to be debited

childElements.businessTerm: Invoice line accounting Credit account reference
childElements.semanticDescription: The Buyer assigned accounting reference for the Invoice Line indicating the account to be credited
An accounting reference assigned by the Buyer used for the particular Invoice line, indicating the account to be debited or credited.
childElements.usageNote:
The Buyer's accounting reference is used to automatically record the invoice in the Buyer's accounting system.

Deprecated per 2023-07-01 use Invoice line accounting Debit account reference (BT-198) and Credit account reference (BT-199) instead.

childElements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information about the period relevant for the Invoice line.
childElements.usageNote:
This group is used to provide the period to which the Invoice line refers.
E.g. the period of a subscription. It is useful for ERP systems.

childElements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information about allowances applicable to the individual Invoice line.
A group of business terms providing information about charges applicable to the individual Invoice line.

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing VAT details for the Invoice line
elements.usageNote: This group is used to provide VAT details for the Invoice line where VAT is applied as part of the tax sub scheme.

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information about the price applied for the item.
elements.usageNote: This group includes the price of the item and the unit for the price.

childElements.semanticDescription: The price of an item, exclusive of VAT, after subtracting item price discount.
childElements.usageNote: If the Item net price is negative, the absolute value has to be less than the Invoice line net amount (BT-131).

childElements.semanticDescription: The number of item units to which the price applies.
childElements.usageNote: Used in connection with the Item price base quantity unit of measure code (BT-150).

childElements.businessTerm: Item price base quantity unit of measure
childElements.semanticDescription: The unit of measure for the Item price base quantity.
childElements.usageNote: The unit of measure shall be coded using the UN/ECE Recommendation 20, including common codes [7] [8].

childElements.semanticDescription: The amount to be subtracted from the Item gross price to calculate the Item net price.
The unit price, exclusive of VAT, before subtracting item price discount.
childElements.usageNote: The Item gross price is used if the Item price discount (BT-147) is provided.

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information about the VAT applicable for the goods and services invoiced on the Invoice line.

childElements.semanticDescription: A coded identification of the VAT category applicable to the item invoiced.
childElements.usageNote:
Shall be taken from the UNTDID 5305 code list [6]:
Standard rated (code S), Zero rated goods (code Z), Exempt from tax (code E), VAT Reverse Charge (code AE), VAT exempt for intra community supply of goods and services (code K), Raw material (code A), Services outside scope of tax (code O). Code O represents 'outside scope of VAT'. Code IGDS represents 'Intra-governmental Deferment Scheme'. One of these codes has to be used for each different VAT category identified in the Invoice. The codes used shall be unique within this group.

childElements.semanticDescription: The VAT rate applicable to the item invoiced.
childElements.usageNote:
Format shall be extended to maximum 4 decimals. E.g. 12.3456 means 12.3456 %.
Mandatory if the VAT category code is "Standard rated". In all other cases this element may be absent or maybe present if the rate is 0.
The VAT category rate shall be provided, if the VAT category code (BT-151) is Standard rated.

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information about additional documents supporting the Invoice line.
elements.usageNote: The supporting document can be an attachment as a separate file or it can be embedded into the invoice as Base64 data. The element attached document (BT-125) must not contain more than 1MB.

elements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information about the item.
elements.usageNote: This group contains information about the item being sold.

childElements.semanticDescription: A name for an item.
childElements.usageNote: The item name shall be the common name, using keywords, generic terms or  name used by the Seller or generally accepted in the specific market. Example: Electricity, table, chair, labour, services.

childElements.semanticDescription: A description of the item.
childElements.usageNote: The description allows for describing the item and its features in more detail than the Item name.

childElements.semanticDescription: An identifier assigned to the item by the Seller.
An identifier assigned to the item by the Buyer.

An item identifier based on a registered scheme.

The identification scheme identifier for the Item standard identifier
childElements.usageNote:
E.g. Global Trade Item Number GTIN [11].
The identifier is specified by the scheme identifier.

The scheme identifier shall distinguish between the different identification schemes, e.g. the scheme identifier "GTIN" is used for Global Trade Item Number.

childElements.businessTerm:
Item commodity classification identifier

Scheme identifier
childElements.semanticDescription:
A code for classifying the item by its type or nature.

The identification scheme identifier for the Item commodity classification identifier.
childElements.usageNote:
Classification codes are used to allow grouping of items for statistical or other purposes. E.g. UNSPSC [12] or CPV [13] codes can be used. The identifier is specified by the scheme identifier.

The scheme identifier shall distinguish between the different identification schemes. E.g. "CPV" can be used as scheme identifier for Common Procurement Vocabulary, "UNSPSC" for Universal Standard Products and Services Classification.

childElements.semanticDescription: The code identifying the country from which the item originates.
childElements.usageNote: The code shall be taken from the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code list [5].

childElements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information about properties of the item.
